data.title: Worth the visit
data.text:
I recommend ordering off the menu as the buffet like any buffet, tend to not be hot but luke warm. 
The food here is great I love the spicy TIBETAN KHATSA BEEF, they serve a doughy Tibetan style bread that is excellent.  Service is usually pretty good too.

data.title: Terrific Find for Asian Food!
data.text: This is a local restaurant for me.  I just visited for the first time two weeks ago and have already been back!  The staff is very friendly and the menu has excellent choices.  I tend toward the spicy and Nha Sang does not disappoint.  The food tastes very fresh and I think it is a good value.

data.title: I did not know what to expect.  I was pleasantly surprised.
data.text: The General Tso chicken was really tasty.  Nice spice without being too hot.  I was visiting my brother's family.  They had not been there before.  They will make it a regular place now.

data.title: Good for the area
data.text: We have had take-out from Nha Sang many times in the last couple of years and for the most part have been very satisfied. The staff is super friendly and the food is most always on time and good. We had only one meal that was not to their standards, but that's not bad over the course of a year or so. I'd say that this restaurant is very good for being in a suburb. We continue to go here and really like it!

data.title: Fresh food and pleasant staff
data.text: We chose Nha Sang as we were meeting our son and family and it was convenient for all of us. I was hoping to try more Tibetan food, but they only had the spicy chicken. Most of the dishes on the buffet were Chinese and all were tasty. The spicy chicken was good. Our waiter was cheerful and helpful. I guess it won't become a must go to for us, as it was just average.

data.title: Surprise in a strip mall.
data.text: I was staying near by in a motel looking for someplace close by to eat.  I asked a local at the CVS and they recommended Nha Sang.  I had the Walleye in Jalapeno Basil Sauce and it was very good.  I had fresh spring rolls as an appetizer.  Many of the items on the menu have a Tibetan origin.

data.title: Excellent! Try the Beef Shapta
data.text: We love this restaurant - we've just been a couple of times as it's not close to our home, but we love the Tibetan Hot Spicy Chicken and the Tibetan Beef Shapta - makes my mouth water, thinking about it.  We love spicy food, so the chili used wasn't an issue for us, and we also enjoyed the Tibetan style bread it was served with.

data.title: A nice change from chain restaurants
data.text: I can't say I was overwhelmed by the food at Nha Sang. The atmosphere was a nice change from all the chain restaurants in Burnsville, but it wasnt somewhere I would make a habit of going. I will say they did a good job with their beef.

data.title: Best fried rice I've ever had
data.text: Love this family-owned restaurant. This is our go-to place for takeout on a regular basis. They also deliver which is great! Super sweet family, excellent food. Nothing compares to their fried rice! Love it!

data.title: Amazing Tibetan Restaurant
data.text: The food at Nha Sang is always excellent.  The Tibetan family-run restaurant is so welcoming.  They adapt foods to not be more spicy than Americans can handle, yet serve delicious authentic delights.

data.title: Little gem
data.text: Stopped here before a concert at Ames Center, so conveniently close.  Glad we chose this restaurant.  Daringly, we both selected something new for us - the cranberry curry with scallops was scrumptious!  Gotta like a little spice, but really delicious.  Mix in the rice and that cools it down a little.  Healthy portion, would definitely order again.  Hubby took the crispy potatoes, scallops and onions in a sweet oyster sauce and just about swooned.  Very friendly, will be back and we hope in the not too distant future!

data.title: What's the Big Deal?
data.text:
I am nervous. Did I make a mistake? Did I miss whatever all of these 5 rating folks experienced? Will they find me and hurt me?

It was fine. We went for the buffet and it was fine. The pepper steak was good, the sesame chicken lovely and the chow mein was chow mein. The hot and sour soup, generally one of my favorites, was a spicy gelatinous bowl of indistinguishable. The chicken wings were so greasy I stopped after one bite. The eggrolls had an unidentifiable protein source and neither of us cared for the lo mein. What is that sauce? Can't tell.

It is located in a strip mall and the owner was really nice. I overheard him say to a customer that he had been in Tibet recently.

Anyway, I understand the dish to try is the Cranberry Curry Chicken and I rolled in ready to play ball but the buffet was my only option. It was fine...3 means it was fine.

data.title: Tibetang/pan Asian
data.text: I love this place. A wonderfully run family restaurant featuring the dishes of their native Tibet and other favorites from around Asia. Whenever I come here I feel like I'm coming home.

data.title: Moderate Price - Meager Service
data.text: The folks are nice, but you have to stand in line at the checkout counter Ito order.  This might be acceptable if the prices were fast-food low . . . But they aren't.  Also, prices like these could easily support AMEX, but they don't accept AMEX.  The food itself is very average.  In summary, the folks are nice, but this restaurant leaves a lot to be desired.

data.title: Jerry d
data.text: Had a number of dishes all tasty. My favorite Tibetan chow mein fantastic good service and great people

data.title: Excellent host! Fantastic Food!
data.text: My wife and I visited this restaurant after reading the excellent reviews tNga Sang had received on Tripadvisor and are we glad we did. The food was excellent with that asian spiciness we just can't seem to capture at home. We had an opportunity to meet the owner who was very friendly and anxious to please. I had the Mongolian beef which I can truthfully say was the best I have ever eaten. They didn't cut corners, the servings were amble, the meat excellent and the vegetables fresh!

data.title: Great inexpensive, tasty dinner
data.text:
Not a great location (strip mall), kind of noisy dining room (young kids),but excellent food and wait staff.

Had the Cranberry Curry with Mock Duck which was surprisingly good. An excellent choice for vegetarians (which I used to be).

A great choice for a quick, delicious meal for the business traveler.

data.title: Just lose the attitude
data.text: The food was good but the attitude that we received from the server was not acceptable, we felt like we were a burden, we were a table of 2 adults, and anytime we asked about the item on the menu, we were put on the back burner. As I said, the food was good, but the attitude killed it.

data.title: Fresh, Friendly, Fantastic
data.text: An eclectic Asian menu with Chinese, Vietnamese, Thai and Tibetan entrees. We opted for Tibetan as the owners hail from Tibet and we were not familiar with the cuisine. We asked our server to guide us to traditional selections which she did willingly and patiently. We followed her advice and weren't disappointed. A chicken soup with homemade noodles, very spicy beef with homemade steamed bread, and steamed pork dumplings.All delicious and obviously freshly prepared. If we had one complaint it was our pot of oolong tea was not hot enough. This is not your cornstarch laden American "Chinese" food. We will be back.

data.title: Unique, fresh and delicious
data.text:
This strip mall gem is worth a visit. The owner has produced a nice combination of Tibetan, SE Asian, and Chinese offerings. Some have a new Minnesotan twist using wild rice or cranberries. The cranberry curry dishes are especially good. The buffet is fine but consider ordering off the menu. We often first rank asian places by their hot and sour soup. The soup here is among the top five in the entire twin cities.
A very friendly staff and quick service. The decor is comfortable and the crowd upbeat. This is our favorite place in Burnsville.
